text:
76 year old male with history of AS/AI and bilateral total hip
   replacements w. recurrent pain who underwent left hip surgery at NEBH
   on [**3-8**], however post-op course was c/b SSCP and subsequent NSTEMI.
   Transferred to [**Hospital1 19**] for MI care, pain-free on heparin gtt prior to
   cath on [**3-12**]. Cath showed- 3 VD, severe AS and severe pulmonary arterial
   HTN and heart failure. Cardiac surgery consulted for CABG/AVR. Remains
   in CCU post-cath and pre- op for plavix washout.
   Myocardial infarction, acute (AMI, STEMI, NSTEMI)
   Assessment:
   NSTEMI 48 hours ago as above at OSH in post-op setting. s/p cath [**3-12**]
   which showed: 3 VD, PA HTN, diastolic heart failure as well as
   pre-procedure AFib. Now in NSR rate 70-90 w/ frequent multifocal
   PVC
s/bigeminy. SBP range 99-120s /50s. Right groin dressing post-cath
   remains c,d& i. pedal pulses easily palpable, remains CP free. Heparin
   off since cath lab confirmed with CCU team.
   Action:
    Monitored right groin site and pulses post-cath. Monitored for pain.
   Followed lab results. Monitored I&O in setting of diastolic heart
   failure. Given 20 meq po K+ for afternoon level of 3.8. Given 2 gm MG+
   for afternoon level of 1.8. CSurg consulted by CCU team for CABG/AVR.
   Response:
   Groin site remained stable and unchanged overnight w/ no heme/ooze or
   pain. Pulses easily palpable. AM HCT on [**3-13**]- 25.5 (same as
   post-transfusion HCT level from prior shift). Platelets WNL post-cath.
   Pt. requesting large volumes water/ice overnight, which were given in
   limited quantities given pt.
s high filling pressures and diuresis in
   cath lab. Currently is
 200 cc
s since midnight. Continues to deny CP.
   Heparin gtt remains off per team despite known 3 VD w. rationale that
   pt had low HCT since hip surgery and is 48 hours from the onset of his
   NSTEMI. AM K+ 4.2 and Mg+ 2.5.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor groin site and pedal pulses. Follow labs as
   ordered. Monitor for any s/s CP. Hold plavix [**3-13**] for wash-out pre-op.
   Carotid u/s ordered as well as cardiac echo for pre-op workup. Provide
   emotional support to patient.
   [**Last Name **] Problem
 s/p l hip replacment
   Assessment:
   s/p left hip surgery on [**3-8**] at OSH. Left hip dressing c,d, and intact
   although not dated (changed on [**3-12**] by ortho team per report), no
   drainage seen, although area of ecchymosis seen beyond dressing
   extending towards patients left buttock. Mild pain with turning
   although full ROM to pt
s left foot
 patient continues to deny offer
   of pain medication & slept in naps overnight.
   Action:
   Monitored dressing and for c/o worsening pain or loss of ROM.
   Response:
   Dressing remains intact and area of ecchymosis unchanged. Continues to
   have ROM in left ankle, also continues to decline offer of pain
   medication.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor dressing, caution w/ turning and continue
   pain-management as needed.
   Add: post-cath renal function slightly worse this am ([**3-13**]) per labs-
   CR 1.3 (1.2) and BUN 30 (23).
